field.name: Theme-options
field.label: Theme Options
field.description: The settings on this panel determine the styling of the theme. After making changes here you must compile less to css before being able to see the changes take affect on the front end of your site.

field.name: tipfortheme
field.description: Click the show advanced options to edit settings available for this theme.

field.name: primary
field.label: Primary
field.description: Primary Color

field.name: secondary
field.label: Secondary
field.description: Secondary Color

field.name: rows
field.label: Row style
field.description: The following settings adds the selected style to the selected row of modules. TYou can add more styles here by adding your own less files to the settings/themes/styles folder of your template. The name of the file is added as a class to the row in question eg .dark-row or .primary-row.

field.name: FontAwesome
field.label: Font Awesome
field.description: This setting determines the number of font icons included and compiled in your template's css file. The minimum file will load the requried font icons for use in menus, panels etc that are called by the theme. If you wish to use more than this (via the Zen Shortcode plugin) you will need to include the full Font Awesome library. This setting can be disabled if you want to include an icon library via another method.

field.name: Bootstrap
field.label: Bootstrap
field.description: This theme does not require the Bootstrap css framework to render it's core functionality and standard Joomla views. If you are using other components that use bootstrap markup you will need to enable this option. This theme implements either Bootstrap 2 or Bootstrap 3 in a selective manner. By disabling certain unneeded bootstrap files you will be able to reduce the size of your template.css and remove unneeded css rules from your site's assets.

field.name: framework_enable
field.label: Use 3rd Party css Framework?
field.description: When enabled this setting compiles the files selected below from the css framework compatible with this template.

field.name: framework_files_group
field.label: Framework files to compile
field.description: When enabled this setting loads Joomla's core framework javascript files.

field.name: Font-control
field.label: Font Control
field.description: The settings on this panel determine the font display for body, heading, navigation and logo tags on your site. After making changes to the settings below it is necessary to compile less to css by using the compile less button in the toolbar.

field.name: use_font_loader
field.label: Use font loader?
field.description: When enabled the javascript font loader is used to load fonts. If you are loading a single google font it's likely that having this option disabled will yield a better page load speed. However if you load more than one font the font loader allows the the page to load before the resources are loaded. This can lead to a FOUT - flash of unstyled content.

field.name: use_typekit
field.label: Use typekit fonts?
field.description: When enabled this option embeds the require javascript to use Typekit fonts in your template. Enter the name of the typekit kit you wish to use in the input below.

field.name: bodyfont

field.name: Layout
field.label: Layout Control
field.description: The layout of this template can be controlled by dragging and resizing the blocks displayed below. Click on the eye icon to remove a module and likewise click on the modules listed below the row to reinstate specific modules.

field.name: hidefrontpage
field.label: Hide maincontent on front page
field.description: When enabled the main content block is disabled if the user is on the front page.

field.name: force_equal
field.label: Force even widths
field.description: When enabled if a specific page has fewer modules published than specified in the layout tool below the modules will automatically stretch evenly across the page. Disable this option to force the module widths specified in the tool below in cases where not all modules are published to a specific row on a specific page.

field.label: Master Layout File
field.name: layout_file
field.description: This is an advanced option that allows users to specify a layout other than the the default layout file. Your new file needs to be added to the tpls/ folder.

field.label: Responsive
field.name: Responsive
field.description: The responsive panel determines how your template behaves across various screen sizes. The breakpoints specified below for the laptop and phone max width are used in the layotu tool to determine when a row should be displayed, stacked or hidden from view.

field.name: enable_responsive
field.label: Enable responsive layouts
field.description: When enabled the template resizes to fit the screen size that the user is viewing their site on. If this option is disabled all responsive behaviour in the template is deactivated

field.name: allow_pinch
field.label: Allow user to pinch and zoom
field.description: When enabled the user is able to pinch and zoom the page on touch enabled devices.

field.label: Collapsed Menu Behaviour
field.name: responsive-menu
field.description: This setting determines what happens to the menu when the the browser is smaller than the nav collapse value specified in the breakpoints section below.

field.name: gridcollapse
field.label: Grid Collapse
field.description: This variable acts as a global setting which can be used to collapse all grid columns at a specific browser width. This value will override the stack settings in the layout tool below.

field.label: Container Widths
field.name: containerwidths
field.description: The following settings determine the max-width for the main website container across 3 different screen sizes. Use % values here for best results.

field.label: Menu Options
field.description: This panel controls the main navigation, sidebar, offcanvas and one page menu options. Collapse navigation options can be found on the Responsive menu tab.

field.label: Dropdown
field.name: Dropdown
field.description: The dropdown menu in this template uses the Zen Menu plugin to generate it's mega menu functionality. Adding icons, subtitles and multiple column menu items can be done (after installing the Zenmenu plugin) via the menu manager. Edit the menu you wish to apply mega menu fucntionality to and click on the zen menu tab in the menu settings. Icons and subtitles can be added to any standard Joomla menu - including sidebar, top and footer menus.

field.name: dropdown_min_width
field.label: Dropdown Minimum width
field.description: This parameter needs to be set in px.

field.label: Accordion
field.name: accordion
field.description: The accordion menu makes it possible to display a complex menu with multiple sub level items in a streamlined manner.

field.name: accordion
field.label: Enable Accordion
field.description: When enabled javascript is loaded in the template that allows the triggering of an accordion menu in the sidebar of the template.

field.name: accordionType
field.label: Accordion Type
field.description: The default behaviour for the accordion menu is to behave like a true accordion where clicking on one menu item closes all other currently open menu items. Using the panel behaviour changes this so that clicking on a menu item only opens or closes the child menu items of the menu you have clicked on.

field.name: accordionOpenFirst
field.label: Always open first item
field.description: When this option is enabled the first item int he accordion always opens regardless of whether it is the active item or not.

field.name: accordionShowActive
field.label: Always show active menu item
field.description: When this option is enabled the panel for the currently active menu item is open.

field.name: Offcanvas
field.label: Offcanvas
field.description: The offcanvas panel will display on a page if a module is published to the offcanvas module position or the navcollapse menu type is set to offcanvas.

field.name: offcanvas_trigger
field.label: Offcanvas trigger text
field.description: This option determines the text used to trigger the off canvas panel. It is possible to use shortcode syntax such as {zen-bars}{/zen-bars}.

field.label: One Page
field.name: onepagelayout
field.description:
One page mode transforms this theme into a one page scrolling template that uses various anchor points on the page to smooth scroll the browser window to the corresponding anchor point on the page.

The page is divided into corresponding rows that can be viewed on the layout tab in the template settings - eg grid1 to grid4.
The menu items listed below will only be displayed if you have modules published to the appropriate module positions. For instance if you have a module published to grid1, grid,2 grid3 or grid4 then the menu item called Grid1 - Grid4 row menu text will appear on the page.

field.name: homelink
field.label: Home link text
field.description: Enter the text for the anchor that links to the home link. Leave this option empty if you would like to not link to this row.

field.name: bannerlink
field.label: Banner row link text
field.description: Enter the text for the anchor that links to the home link. Leave this option empty if you would like to not link to this row.

field.name: grid1link
field.label: Grid block 1 - (grid1 to grid4) row link text
field.description: Enter the text for the anchor that links to the grid1 row. Leave this option empty if you would like to not link to this row.

field.name: grid2link
field.label: Grid block 2 - (grid5 to grid8) row link text
field.description: Enter the text for the anchor that links to the grid2 row. Leave this option empty if you would like to not link to this row.

field.name: grid3link
field.label: Grid block 3 - (grid9 to grid12) row link text
field.description: Enter the text for the anchor that links to the grid3 row. Leave this option empty if you would like to not link to this row.

field.name: mainlink
field.label: Main content link text
field.description: Enter the text for the anchor that links to the Main row. Leave this option empty if you would like to not link to this row.

field.name: grid4link
field.label: Grid block 4 - (grid13 to grid16) row link text
field.description: Enter the text for the anchor that links to the grid4 row. Leave this option empty if you would like to not link to this row.

field.name: grid5link
field.label: Grid block 5 - (grid17 to grid20) row link text
field.description: Enter the text for the anchor that links to the grid5 row. Leave this option empty if you would like to not link to this row.

field.name: grid6link
field.label: Grid block 16 - (grid21 to grid24) row link text
field.description: Enter the text for the anchor that links to the grid6 row. Leave this option empty if you would like to not link to this row.

field.name: bottomlink
field.label: Bottom row link text
field.description: Enter the text for the anchor that links to the bottom row. Leave this option empty if you would like to not link to this row.

field.label: Template Effects
field.description: This panel controls the various effects integrated into the theme including css3 animations, lazyload, back to top and sticky nav.

field.label: CSS3 Effects
field.name: css3
field.description: The settings in this panel add css3 animations to the entire row of modules. When the page first loads and when the content becomes visible in the browser the content for that row will become visible using the animation specified in the settings below. Please note that while css3 animations can be fun you can overdo it, so use these settings wisely.

field.label: Lazyload
field.name: lazyload
field.description: This setting enables you to delay the loading of images on the page until the user scrolls down the page.

field.name: llselector
field.description: Apply lazy load effect for the following elements
field.label: Lazyload selector e.g. img, #midCol img

field.name: llnotselector
field.description: Disable lazy load effect for the following elements
field.label: Disable Lazyload selector e.g. .nolazy
Back to top
field.name: totop
field.description: When the following setting is enabled a back to top item appears on your site after the user scrolls down the page. When clicked the browser is scrolled to the top of the page.

field.name: backtotoptext
field.description: Text for back to top button
field.label: Back to top text

field.name: stickynav
field.label: Stickynav
field.description:
Stickynav makes the navigation bar stick to the top of the browser when a user scrolls down past the navigation area.
Please note: Sticky nav is automatically disabled for small screens.

field.label: Social Sharing
field.description: This theme has a number of built in methods for connecting your website to popular social networking sites. Use the settings below to integrate social icons, share buttons and more.

field.name: social-top-offset
field.label: Social icons top offset
field.description: This setting determines the disatance from the top of the browser window that the social icons and hidden panel icon sit.

field.name: twitter
field.label: Enable Twitter tools
field.description: This setting enables the Twitter functionality in this theme.

field.name: twitter_share
field.label: Enable Twitter share
field.description: If this setting is enabled the twitter icon is transformed into a custom tweet this button. When the user clicks the icon the a box will popup with the details of the page they are about to tweet about.

field.name: facebook
field.label: Enable Facebook tools
field.description: This setting enables the Facebook functionality in this theme.
Enter the url of the facebook page you want your icon to link to.
field.name: facebook_url
field.label: Facebook Url

field.name: facebook_share
field.label: Enable Facebook share
field.description: If this setting is enabled the facebook icon is transformed into a custom share button. When the user clicks the icon the article will be shared on their facebook page.

field.name: gplus
field.label: Enable Google Plus tools
field.description: This setting enables the Google Plus functionality in this theme.

field.name: gplus_share
field.label: Enable Google Plus share
field.description: If this setting is enabled the google plus icon is transformed into a share this button. When the user clicks the icon the a box will popup with the details of the page they are about to share.
Enter the url of the googleplus page you want your icon to link to.
field.name: gplus_url
field.label: Google Plus Url

field.name: pinterest
field.label: Enable Pinterest tools
field.description: This setting enables the Pinterest functionality in this theme.

field.name: pinterest_share
field.label: Enable Pinterest share
field.description: If this setting is enabled the pinterest icon is transformed into a custom pinit button. When the user clicks the icon the a box will popup with the details of the page they are about to pin.
Enter the url of the pinterest page you want your icon to link to.
field.name: pinterest_url
field.label: Pinterest Url

field.description: Extra social link
field.name: extra-social
field.label: Extra Social Url
Delete stored configurations
field.description: This panel makes it possible to remove previously stored configuration files for this theme. The theme uses a hierarchy of configuration files to make it possible to load different page layouts and themes on different pages in wordpress. eg if the config-single file exists then that is the configuration that will be used for all pages that use the wordpress single layout.

field.name: delete-items
field.label: Remove Items
field.description: Select the configuration you wish to remove from thsi theme and then click on the delet button.

field.label: Performance and Optimisation
field.description: This panel holds settings that can optimise the way that your template and website functions. Please note that some of the settings below require you css to be recompiled and your javascript to be recompressed.

field.name: Framework Settings
field.label: CSS Settings
field.description: The following settings determine the way that this template handles it's css assets. The template uses .less files to collect the data stored in the template settings in order to output a single css file. The settings below can be used to change or optimsie this behaviour based on your needs.

field.name: devmode
field.label: Enable dev mode
field.description:
Recommended for development if not using external compiler.
This setting loads .less files on the front end of your site. This means you can preview changes to less files without compiling them using an external program such as codekit, koala, winless etc. Disable this option if site is in production or you use an external compiling application.

field.name: watch_mode
field.label: Less Watch Mode
field.description: When enabled development mode watches your template less files for real time changes and refreshes those changes in the browser without refreshing the page. This function can be somewhat cpu intensive and may cause your browser to slow down.

field.name: compresscss
field.label: Compress CSS Output
field.description:
Recommended for production websites.
When enabled the less compiler outputs compressed css into the css file. After changing this setting it is necessary to recompile / save your style under the style tab. Compile less to css after changing this setting

field.name: gzip_css
field.description: When enabled the css file is loaded in a gzipped format. Gzipping assets can offer superior speed improvements for your pages.
field.label: GZIP CSS output

field.name: add_to_compiler
field.description: Enter a comma separated list of files here to add to the main template css file. To add a file here you need to add the relative path to the file on your site. eg media/mod_zentools/less/zentools.less. After adding your filename here click save and then the compile to less button in the toolbar.

field.name: javascript
field.label: Javascript
field.description: This template loads a single javascript file which includes it's core javascript assets and any additional assets listed below. These assets are determined in the settings/assets.xml file. The file that is generated is output to templates/this_template/js/template.js or to templates/this_template/js/template-66.js depending on the settings below.

field.name: compressjs
field.label: Load compressed Javascript file
field.description: When enabled a single javascript file is used on the front end of your site. Click the Compress scripts button below after changing this setting

field.name: gzip_js
field.description: When enabled the javascript file is loaded in a gzipped format. Gzipping assets can offer superior speed improvements for your pages.
field.label: GZIP Javascript output

field.name: add_to_compressor
field.description: Enter a comma separated list of files here to add to the main template js file. To add a file here you need to add the relative path to the file on your site. eg media/myfolder.myjsfile.js. After adding your filename here click save and then the compress scripts button in the toolbar.

field.label: jQuery Settings
field.description: The jQuery library is required for this template and is loaded by default.

field.name: replace_jQuery
field.label: Replace jQuery
field.description: This setting will replace the Wordpress jQuery with a copy from Google's CDN or from a file specified in the input below.

field.label: CDN
field.name: cdn
field.description: The CDN option exchanges the path to the core template assets to the url listed below. This is a manual feature and after activating this option you are required to upload the template assets to the path specified. Please read the framework documentation for further information.

field.name: enable_cdn
field.description: When enabled the javascript file is loaded from the url specified. You need to use a 3rd party service to move the file to your cdn or do this manually. The javascript file can be located in the js/ folder of this template.
field.label: Enable CDN
Custom Scripts
field.name: customscripts
field.description: Enter your custom scripts and analytics code in the text boxes below. Code added here is reproduced in the template directly and is not added to the template's compressor.

field.name: after_head_scripts
field.label: After opening head tag
field.description: Enter any script here that you want to appear after the opening head tags. Please ensure you include the appropriate script or style tags here.

field.name: before_head_scripts
field.label: Before closing head tag (Add Google Analytics here)
field.description: Enter any script here that you want to appear before the closing head tags. (Add Google Analytics here). Please ensure you include the appropriate script or style tags here.

field.name: after_body_scripts
field.label: After opening body tag
field.description: Enter any script here that you want to appear after opening body tags. Please ensure you include the appropriate script or style tags here.

field.name: before_body_scripts
field.label: Before closing body tag
field.description: Enter any script here that you want to appear before the closing body tags. Please ensure you include the appropriate script or style tags here.

field.name: mobile-detect
field.label: Mobile Detect
field.description: When this option is enabled a server side function is used to determine whether the user is on a tablet, phone or other device. Server side applications can increase the loading of the template slightly however it will significantly improve the users experience on these devices. If this option is disabled then content set to be hidden on phones and tablets are simply hidden from view as opposed to not loaded at all. If a row is set to be hidden on a specific device then it will not show on that device regardless of the breakpoints set under the responsive tab. WARNING: This option is not compatible with Wordpress cache plugins which saves copies of pages to be reused for different visitors on different devices.

field.label: Template Administrator Settings
field.description: When enabled all descriptions are hidden in the template admin. This option is designed for those of you who already understand what each setting does and simply want to save some real estate in the template administrator.

field.name: hide_info
field.description: When enabled all descriptive headings are hidden from view to reduce space used in the admin.
field.label: Hide template setting descriptions
Debug
field.description: These settings help to debug the template by providing feedback on the front end of the site regarding the current settings of the theme as well as load a default template.css file.

field.name: load_template_css
field.description: When enabled the template loads the default css file called template.css This is designed for developers and designers who would want to work directly from the template.less file and compile a template.css file directly.
field.label: Load template.css file

field.name: print_settings
field.description: When enabled the general template settings and theme settings are output at the bottom of the page.
field.label: Print Template settings
